summary: The Student Empowerment Act (H.R. 939) proposes amending the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to allow for the use of 529 education savings accounts to cover a broader range of K-12 educational expenses. This includes tuition, curriculum materials, books, online resources, tutoring, standardized tests, dual enrollment fees, and educational therapies for students with disabilities. It extends these provisions to homeschool settings. The amendment applies to distributions made after the date of the Act's enactment.
